name: Autopkg
body:
AutoPkg
=======

AutoPkg is a system for automatically preparing software for distribution to
managed clients. Recipes allow you to specify a series of simple actions which
combined together can perform complex tasks, similar to Automator workflows or
Unix pipes.

See [the wiki](https://github.com/autopkg/autopkg/wiki#introduction) for more information.

Installation
------------

To install AutoPkg, unpack the distribution and run

`sudo ./install.sh`

This will set up a packaging server and a launchd job so regular users can create packages.


Configuration
-------------

Set MUNKI_REPO in ~/Library/Preferences/com.googlecode.autopkg.plist if you want recipes to populate your munki repository. Has to be XML format for now as it's read with plistlib, and there's a sample file under Test/com.googlecode.autopkg.plist.


Usage
-----

`/Library/AutoPkg/autopkg recipe.plist`

Sample Recipes
--------------

A few recipes are included for your experimentation. The Munki directory contains recipes that import apps into a Munki repository. The Pkg directory contains recipes that create installer packages.
